intro: Malesherbia auristipulata, commonly known as the golden leaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers and heart-shaped leaves. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
